intro: Calchas scutellarioides var. limnophila, commonly known as the water scutellaria, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats. It features slender, upright stems that are often covered in fine hairs. Its lance-shaped leaves are arranged alternately along the stem and are typically dark green in color. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from blue to purple, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist or aquatic environments and is often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds.
